Yes, there are several filmmaking methods that allow for adaptability and flexibility during the production process. One common approach is to have a script supervisor on set who can help keep track of changes to the script and make sure that continuity is maintained. Another technique is to have a rehearsal period before shooting begins, during which the director and actors can explore the material and make adjustments to the script as necessary.

In terms of Jim Jarmusch's approach, he is known for being very collaborative with his actors and often allows them to improvise or bring their own ideas to the table. He also tends to shoot his films in a more free-form style, often relying on long takes and natural lighting to capture the moment. This approach can allow for more spontaneity and improvisation on set, which can lead to unexpected but often interesting results.
